title: Summary table
text: demonstrate various functionalities function use dataset survival::colon. dataset colon contains data 1858 patients one first successful trials adjuvant chemotherapy colon cancer. simplicity, focus recurrence , two treatment groups, four variable: treatment group (rx), sex (Male), age (age) extent local spread (extent). also add missing values variable extent.
code: library(survival) data(cancer, package="survival")  colon1 <-  colon %>%   group_by(id) %>%   slice(1) %>% # Select the first row within each id group   ungroup() set.seed(123) colon2 <- colon1 %>%   select(rx, sex, age, extent) %>%   filter(rx != "Lev") %>%   mutate(rx = if_else(rx == "Obs", "Control", rx),          extent = if_else(row_number() %in% sample(row_number(), size = round(0.1 * n())), NA, extent)) %>%    rename(Male = sex) %>%    mutate(extent = as.factor(extent))  # colon2$rx <- droplevels(colon2$rx) head(colon2) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   rx       Male   age extent #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <fct>  #> 1 Lev+5FU     1    43 3      #> 2 Lev+5FU     1    63 3      #> 3 Control     0    71 2      #> 4 Lev+5FU     0    66 3      #> 5 Control     1    69 3      #> 6 Lev+5FU     0    57 3

title: Summary table
text: default, function produces table variables present dataset. Characteristic N = 6191 rx  Control 315 (51%) Lev+5FU 304 (49%) Male  0 312 (50%) 1 307 (50%) age 61.0 (18.0, 85.0) extent  1 17 (3%) 2 68 (11%) 3 446 (72%) 4 26 (4%) Missing 62 (10%) 1n (%); Median (Min, Max) displayed name variable label exists dataset variable name label present dataset (case example). order customize displayed name, argument labelcan used: Characteristic N = 6191 Arm  Control 315 (51%) Lev+5FU 304 (49%) Male  0 312 (50%) 1 307 (50%) Age 61.0 (18.0, 85.0) Extent  1 17 (3%) 2 68 (11%) 3 446 (72%) 4 26 (4%) Missing 62 (10%) 1n (%); Median (Min, Max) Equivalently, labels can added directly dataset.
code: summaryTable(data = colon2) summaryTable(data = colon2,               labels = list(rx = "Arm", age = "Age", extent = "Extent"))

title: Summary table
code: summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx",               labels = list(age = "Age", extent = "Extent")) summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx", overall = TRUE,                labels = list(age = "Age", extent = "Extent"))

title: Summary table
text: specific variables included table, can written argument vars. Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Age 60.0 (18.0, 85.0) 62.0 (26.0, 81.0) 1Median (Min, Max) default, function plots median range continuous variables. number options available, using argument stat_cont.
code: summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx", vars = "age",               labels = list(age = "Age"))

title: Summary table
text: Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Age 60.0 (53.0, 68.0) 62.0 (52.0, 70.0) 1Median (Q1, Q3)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx", vars = "age",               stat_cont = "median_IQR",                labels = list(age = "Age"))

title: Summary table
text: Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Age 59.5 (12.0) 59.7 (12.3) 1Mean (SD)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "age",               stat_cont = "mean_sd",                labels = list(age = "Age"))

title: Summary table
text: default, p-value confidence (CI) displayed. p-values can added setting test TRUE CI setting ci TRUE. default test CI types continuous variable wilcox.test. can changed test_cont ci_cont, respectively. Characteristic Control  N = 3151 95% CI Lev+5FU  N = 3041 95% CI p-value2 Age 59.5 (12.0) [59, 62] 59.7 (12.3) [59, 62] 0.60 1Mean (SD) 2Wilcoxon rank sum test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "age",               stat_cont = "mean_sd",               test = TRUE,              ci = TRUE,              labels = list(age = "Age")              )

title: Summary table
text: categorical variables, percentage automatically added next missing. can disabled setting argument missing FALSE. Characteristic Control  N = 3151 95% CI Lev+5FU  N = 3041 95% CI p-value2 Extent     0.37 1 8 (3%) [1.2%, 5.1%] 9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  2 38 (12%) [8.8%, 16%] 30 (10%) [6.9%, 14%]  3 222 (70%) [65%, 75%] 224 (74%) [68%, 78%]  4 17 (5%) [3.3%, 8.7%] 9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  Missing 30 (10%) [6.6%, 13%] 32 (11%) [7.4%, 15%]  1n (%) 2Pearson's Chi-squared test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval Note p-value always calculated ignoring missing values. categorical variables, default test type chisq.test default CI types wilson. can changed test_cat ci_cat, respectively. tables without missing values can also put next setting missing "".  missing Without missing Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Extent     1 8 (3%) 9 (3%) 8 (3%) 9 (3%) 2 38 (12%) 30 (10%) 38 (13%) 30 (11%) 3 222 (70%) 224 (74%) 222 (78%) 224 (82%) 4 17 (5%) 9 (3%) 17 (6%) 9 (3%) Missing 30 (10%) 32 (11%)   1n (%)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "extent",               test = TRUE,              ci = TRUE,              missing = TRUE,               labels = list(extent = "Extent")              ) summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "extent",               missing = "both",                labels = list(extent = "Extent")              )

title: Summary table
text: default, levels showed binary variables. Setting argument binary TRUE shows one level: Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Male   0 149 (47%) 163 (54%) 1 166 (53%) 141 (46%) 1n (%) Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Male   0 149 (47%) 163 (54%) 1 166 (53%) 141 (46%) 1n (%)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "Male",               missing = FALSE              ) summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "Male",               binary = TRUE,               missing = FALSE)

title: Summary table
text: Digits can customized arguments digits_contand digits_cat.

title: Summary table
text: Adding time--event endpoints New functions: summaryByVisit summaryLevel Adding tests

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sämi Schär. Author. Charlotte Micheloud. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schär S, Micheloud C (2025). summarySCI: Produces publication-ready summary tables. R package version 0.1.0, https://swisscancerinstitute-statistics.github.io/summaryswisscancerinstitute/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {summarySCI: Produces publication-ready summary tables},   author = {Sämi Schär and Charlotte Micheloud},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://swisscancerinstitute-statistics.github.io/summaryswisscancerinstitute/}, }

title: Produces publication-ready summary tables
text: Welcome development branch package function summaryTable package summarySCI. can install development version using

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
text: Collapses factor levels multiple columns one creates summary table.

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
code: summaryLevels(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   label = NULL,   levels = NULL,   stat_cat = "n_percent",   test = FALSE,   test_cat = "fisher.test",   ci = FALSE,   ci_cat = "wilson",   conf_level = 0.95,   overall = FALSE,   as_flex_table = TRUE )

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Variables include summary table. Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. label list containing labels used variables table. NULL, labels automaticall taken dataset. label present, variable name taken. levels = vector containing values indicating presence factor level. Included defaul "1", "yes", "Yes". stat_cat Summary statistic display categorical variables. Options include "n_percent" (default) "n", "n_N". test Logical. Indicates whether p-values displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE test_cat Test type used calculated p-value categorical variables.  used test = TRUE. Options include "chisq.test", "chisq.test..correct", "fisher.test" (default). ci Logical. Indicates whether CI displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE. ci_cat Confidence interval method categorical variables. Options include "wilson" (default), "wilson..correct", "clopper.pearson", "wald", "wald..correct", "agresti.coull" "jeffreys". NULL, CI displayed. conf_level Confidence level. Default 0.95. overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Default FALSE. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE (default) gtsummary object converted flextable object. Useful rendering Word.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: Creates publication-ready summary tables based gtsummary package.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
code: summaryTable(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   labels = NULL,   stat_cont = "median_range",   stat_cat = "n_percent",   test = FALSE,   test_cont = "wilcox.test",   test_cat = "chisq.test",   ci = FALSE,   ci_cont = "wilcox.test",   ci_cat = "wilson",   conf_level = 0.95,   digits_cont = 1,   digits_cat = 0,   missing = TRUE,   binary = FALSE,   missing_text = "Missing",   overall = FALSE,   as_flex_table = TRUE )

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Variables include summary table. Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. labels list containing labels used variables table. NULL, labels automatically taken dataset. label present, variable name taken. stat_cont Summary statistic display continuous variables. Options include "median_IQR", "median_range" (default), "mean_sd", "mean_se" "geomMean_sd". stat_cat Summary statistic display categorical variables. Options include "n_percent" (default) "n", "n_N". test Logical. Indicates whether p-values displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE test_cont Test type used calculate p-value continuous variables. used test = TRUE. Options include "t.test", "oneway.test", "kruskal.test", "wilcox.test" (default), "paired.t.test", "paired.wilcox.test" test_cat Test type used calculated p-value categorical variables.  used test = TRUE. Options include "chisq.test" (default), "chisq.test..correct", "fisher.test". ci Logical. Indicates whether CI displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE. ci_cont Confidence interval method continuous variables. used ci = TRUE. Options include "t.test" "wilcox.test" (default). ci_cat Confidence interval method categorical variables. Options include "wilson" (default), "wilson..correct", "clopper.pearson", "wald", "wald..correct", "agresti.coull" "jeffreys". NULL, CI displayed. conf_level Confidence level. Default 0.95. digits_cont Digits summary statistics CI continuous variables. Default 1. digits_cat Digits summary statistics CI categorical variables. Default 0. missing Indicates whether percentages missings shown (TRUE, default) (FALSE) categorical variables.Categorical variables need factors work. "", options displayed next . binary taken account missing = FALSE. binary variables, indicates whether levels displayed (FALSE, default) one. missing_text String indicating text shown missing row. Default "Missing". overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Default FALSE. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE (default) gtsummary object converted flextable object. Useful rendering Word.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: Characteristic N = 2281 Institution code 11.0 (1.0, 33.0) Missing 1 Time 255.5 (5.0, 1,022.0) Age 63.0 (39.0, 82.0) ECOG score  0 63 (28%) 1 113 (50%) 2 50 (22%) 3 1 (0%) Missing 1 (0%) 1Median (Min, Max); n (%)
